intro: Antirrhinum majus var. ochroleucum, commonly known as the white snapdragon, is a variant of the common snapdragon characterized by its pale yellow to white flowers. It is a herbaceous annual plant native to southern Europe, often found in meadows and woodland edges. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with two upper petals and three lower ones, forming a distinctive "snapdragon" shape. This variety is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
